temperature neededwhy obtaining a high density of hydrogen nuclei is difficult

lowest possible temperature/°Cparticle energy

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 400, 106, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>33</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 400, 850, 420]]<|/det|>
The scattering of alpha-particles from a thin gold foil produces the following observations.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 431, 621, 450]]<|/det|>
· Most of the alpha-particles pass through the foil.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 457, 650, 476]]<|/det|>
· Most of the alpha-particles are virtually undeflected.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 483, 823, 502]]<|/det|>
· A small fraction of the alpha-particles are deflected through large angles.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 508, 789, 527]]<|/det|>
· A very small fraction of the alpha-particles bounce back from the foil.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 537, 608, 556]]<|/det|>
Which conclusion does **not** follow from these observations?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 567, 133, 585]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 567, 571, 585]]<|/det|>
Most of the mass of the gold atom is in its nucleus.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 594, 133, 612]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 594, 425, 612]]<|/det|>
Most of the atom is empty space.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 621, 131, 638]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 621, 534, 638]]<|/det|>
The nucleus consists of protons and neutrons.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 647, 133, 664]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 647, 403, 664]]<|/det|>
The nucleus must be charged.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 689, 106, 708]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 689, 480, 708]]<|/det|>

\[\frac{35}{17}\mathrm{Cl}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 763, 571, 781]]<|/det|>
What is the nucleon number of this nuclide of chlorine?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 791, 133, 809]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 791, 175, 809]]<|/det|>
17

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 791, 298, 809]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[303, 791, 343, 809]]<|/det|>
18

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 791, 467, 809]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[470, 791, 510, 809]]<|/det|>
35
